title: Update Dependencies to support Rust Stable
body: Since async await is now stable on Rust Beta 1.39, using the futures ecosystem should work just fine, except there's still many crates that have #![feature(async_await)] somewhere in their dependency graph. Most crates have been updated by now. This updates hyper-rustls as well.

title: bound the inner stream on AsyncRead + AsyncWrite rather than Read + Write
cargo: switch to 2018 edition
body: This fixes the codebase for Rust edition 2018, and switches the crate to it.

title: Update to *ring* 0.16
body:
This updates *ring* to 0.16 (plus all related dependencies).
It also contains separate commits for a global rustfmt pass, CI compatibility fixes, and a version bump to prepare for the next release.

Closes: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/issues/74

title: Optionally disable pulling in the tokio runtime
body:
Before this patch, hyper-rustls required pulling in the tokio runtime due to it's use of `hyper::client::HttpConnector`. Unfortunately Fuchsia does not support tokio, which prevents our use of this
library. This PR allows us to optionally disable pulling in tokio, and instead swap in our own version of the hyper `HttpConnector`.

If this PR is accepted, would it be possible for a new version to be cut that allows us to opt out of the tokio dependency? Thanks so much!

title: Forward read_buf and write_buf for MaybeHttpsStream
body: This is more beneficial when it is `Http`, as it allows hyper to make use vectored IO for better throughput.

title: Add hyper support for ALPN h2
examples: wait for all tasks
body:
This properly waits for all asynchronous tasks to complete before
completing.

Closes: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/pull/50
Closes: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/issues/51

title: example: clean and add error handling
body:
This removes all unwraps and excepts from both client and server
examples, as well as adding few more comments to explain what's
going on at each step.

Closes: #14

title: examples/server: warn when aborting on connection errors
body:
As the example server is used for CI purposes, it is convenient that
it aborts on any client error. However this is not the typical behavior
expected from a server, so call it out explicitly.

Ref: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/issues/45

title: travis: add a clippy pass
body:
As clippy is not shipped via rustup and doesn't yet work on stable, this pins to the latest released version and to a known-working recent nightly.

Getting new lints in the future will require manual version bumping, but at least this catches regressions.

title: connector: do not panic on wrong dnsname
body: Fixes: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/issues/42

title: src: update to hyper 0.12
body:
This updates to hyper 0.12 and tokio-rustls 0.6, getting rid of
tokio-proto support.

Fixes: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/issues/39
Fixes: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/issues/40

title: Update to rustls 0.12
body:
This is needed in order to fix some recent breakage in ring on nightly
builds.

Fixes #37.

title: examples/server: fix warnings
body: This fixes an "unused external crate" failure on beta and nightly.

title: lib: add rustdoc comments
body: Fixes https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/issues/15

title: connector: build from custom rustls ClientConfig
body:
This PR introduces support for building an HttpsConnector from an existing rustls ClientConfig.
It implements a `From` trait following hyper-tls approach: https://docs.rs/hyper-tls/0.1.1/hyper_tls/struct.HttpsConnector.html (even if I'm not super-happy with a tuple).
It re-uses existing certs, client and server example to build a full roundtrip test.

Fixes: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/issues/27
Supersedes: https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/pull/6

title: Add a branch for hyper 0.10.x support
body:
I do not really want to merge this into master.
I want this to be it's own branch similar to the 0.9.x branch but for hyper 0.10.x

title: cargo: update depends and bump to 0.8.0
body:
- bump webpki-roots, older webpki crates have been removed from crates.
- Fix multiple versions of the ring package because of tokio-rustls and
 rustls. Bump rustls to match the version and specify the minor
 tokio-rustls version to prempt similar problems in future.

title: cargo: update hyper to 0.11
body:
hyper-0.11 has been released, with tokio-based async support!

This PR updates to the released hyper version, and rebases the whole `current-hyper` branch on top of master.

title: hyper-current: update to latest tokio-based hyper from master
body:
This is a followup to https://github.com/ctz/hyper-rustls/pull/19, it contains all commits from there plus:
 * some more derives
 * a server example directly using tokio-proto
 * refreshing of dependencies, README and travis

Closes #9

title: Update *ring* dependency via Rustls (and webpki-roots) dependencies
body:
Before *ring* 0.9.3, it was possible to link multiple versions of *ring* into a program, e.g. if one version depended on *ring* 0.6 and another depended on *ring* 0.9. Unfortunately, this doesn't work, because the linker doesn't know to how to link *ring*'s C/asm code correctly in that kind of situation. *ring* 0.9.3 added a flag to its Cargo.toml to tell the Rust toolchain to stop allowing multiple versions of *ring* to be linked into the same program, to prevent any problems this may cause.

*ring* 0.9.4 was released with an update to make some crates easier to update to 0.9.x.

title: Bump rustls and webpki-root dependencies again
Bump to the latest version of rustls and webpki-roots
Add link to API docs in README.
Fix endless loop in read when there is io error in underlying_write.
body:
When this happens we early exit from `underlying_read` so flag for eof
is never set. Because of this all `underlying_*` methods now returns
early. Reading again from session data returns 0 which means exit
conditions from loop are never met.

title: Upgrade to Hyper 0.10
body:
This appears to be required for me to be able to use Hyper 0.10.0.
There is so much here that I do not understand.
I do not know if making this change is appropriate in your library.
